comments:
This course is the sequel to EAS 545 and focuses on the planning process for a new technology venture. Like its prerequisite, the course is designed expressly for students of engineering and applied science that have a keen interest in technological innovation. Working in teams, students prepare and present a comprehensive business plan for a high-tech opportunity. Ultimately, each team presents its plan to a panel of distinguished entrepreneurs, investors and advisors from the high-tech industry. 

Nothing but great praise was given for this course. Many students echoed that it was “one of the best, most interesting, and most valuable courses I have ever taken.” Students felt they gained plenty of knowledge and insight, one stating that the class “is much more than a stepping stone for entrepreneurship.” 

Students also found Professor Cassel to be a fantastic teacher. One student claimed that “if you haven’t taken a course with Dr. Cassel while at Penn engineering, then you have wasted your time!” Professor Cassel was found to be engaging in class, with his “experience and grilling [students] really making participants think.” 

Students stated that the course required plenty of work and a strong team, but find the work “very rewarding.” The course is open to those of Junior or higher standing.
